item.title: Dimension of a proper subspace
item.author: shrenik95@gmail.com (Shrenik M)
item.description: Let $V$ be a finite dimensional vector space over the field $F$, with $\dim{V} = n$. We also define the ordered basis for $V$ to be $B = \set{\beta_1, \ldots, \beta_n}$. Consider a subspace $U$ of the vector space $V \subseteq U$. Naturally, we have $\dim{U} \leq \dim{V}$. This is because for any $\alpha \in U$, we have $\alpha \in V$, which can then be expressed as a linear combination of the basis vectors in $B$.
